title: making logos by tweaking existing typefaces
content:
G’day philers,

I’m currently in the R&D phase of designing a new logo for a religious organisation and I’m anticipating wanting to tweak exisiting typeface forms in illustrator to make something a bit special. I’m just wondering if this is a non-issue in terms of licensing, copyright and so on. What are my obligations if any? What do other people do in this situation? what do i need to know? any help would be greatly appreciated,  
cheers

Nick

 [‹ Looking for typeface with Gaelic feel](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504200053/http:/www.typophile.com/node/28260 "Go to previous forum topic") [Appropriate use of small caps ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080504200053/http:/www.typophile.com/node/12543 "Go to next forum topic")
author: nicholasgross

comments.content:
cool sweet, thanks i figured it might’ve been talked about somewheres before  
no worries
